meanings.sent1: The stertor of the old car engine signaled its struggle to start.
meanings.sent2: The stertor of the rusty gate echoed through the quiet night.
meanings.sent3: The stertor of the squeaky toy made the dog tilt its head in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The stertor of the wind through the trees sounded like a ghostly whisper.
meanings.sent5: The stertor of the metal chair scraping against the floor was unbearable.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh or grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door stertored loudly as it swung open.
meanings.sent2: The branches stertor against the window during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to stertor its displeasure at being put in a costume.
meanings.sent4: The old radio seemed to stertor with static before finally playing music.
meanings.sent5: The car engine continued to stertor despite the mechanic's efforts to fix it.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a harsh or grating sound
meanings.sent1: The stertor wind made it hard to hear anything else.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a stertor creak whenever the wind blew.
meanings.sent3: The stertor alarm clock was enough to wake up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The old record player had a stertor quality to its music.
meanings.sent5: The stertor floorboards gave away the burglar's presence in the house.
